intro: Megahertzia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the giant clubmoss, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that form a dense, bushy crown. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically clustered in cones at the base of the leaves. Native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia, it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
